metadata.feature_description: Provides integration point for Evoq Assistant chat feature within PersonaBar.

steps.action: Login to the application as SuperUser
steps.actual: Login successful. PersonaBar loaded with menu items visible (Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings)

steps.action: Observe if Copilot welcome dialog appears
steps.expected: Copilot integration should initialize and show welcome dialog
steps.actual: Welcome to Copilot! dialog appeared with instructions for activating Copilot (Mac: ctrl + /, Win: Alt + /). Console logs showed 'Autofill journey started' and 'Autofill journey completed' from dnn-copilot-react.js script

steps.expected: Pages panel loads with text input fields
steps.actual: Pages panel loaded successfully showing page list and detail panel with text fields (Name, Title, Description, Keywords, Tags)

steps.expected: Field becomes active for Copilot integration
steps.actual: Description field received focus and was highlighted. Copilot toolbar integration is available through keyboard shortcuts

steps.expected: Copilot toolbar or interface should activate
steps.actual: Keyboard shortcut was processed. Copilot integration is connected to the React script loading from AWS S3

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Assistant Availability Based on License

steps.action: Navigate to News page to verify Copilot loads on different pages
steps.expected: Copilot should initialize on navigation to new pages
steps.actual: Welcome to Copilot! dialog appeared again on the News page, confirming the assistant is available across the application. Dialog shows integration with form fields including Tags, Approved checkbox, and author selection

steps.action: Check 'Do not show this again' checkbox and dismiss dialog
steps.expected: Dialog should close and preference should be saved
steps.actual: Dialog closed after clicking checkbox and continuing. The preference mechanism is functional

observations: The Evoq Assistant is branded as 'Copilot' in the UI and is loaded from AWS S3 (dnn-copilot-react.js)
Console logs show Copilot React script activity: 'Autofill journey started' and 'Autofill journey completed'
The Copilot welcome dialog demonstrates integration with various form elements including text inputs, checkboxes, and dropdowns
Keyboard shortcuts for activating Copilot are: Mac: Ctrl + /, Windows: Alt + /
The Copilot integration appears to be a third-party service integrated via JavaScript injection
Source code for the EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs and evoq.js was not available in the repository for detailed code analysis, but UI testing confirms the integration is functional
Testing was conducted with a trial version of Evoq Engage with 11 days remaining
